nkqTVGXacPu2Ffim64ZO8g.text: Delicious hot dogs and Elote(mexican corn on the cob). And pretty cheap for Vegas. It is a small shop, but the service is great. But I tried it anyway on recommendation of the cook and was really surprised at how delicious it was! Even the bun is better than any I have had before! Look forward to my next visit!

2A7IA6tbzxFgqako-gYW4Q.text: It's 11:42 and this became one of my favorite hot dog joints a few weeks when I had visited the one on rainbow. But this spot on the strip was the opposite. They had no cheese no fries! I was really upset because my favorite dog was the patty melt. So I ended up ordering the red dog with the special cream cheese sauce which I did not get on my hot dog. Also wanted to order one of the specialty fries but couldn't because no cheese and no fries!.. this was really upsetting... the wings we orders was dryer than the desert in Las Vegas. I give 5 stars on the rainbow location but the one on the strip 2 stars....

XsZ0z-WFzaPoGNZa9h2Jfw.text: Dogs are pretty good. Had the dirty chilly cheese dog. The best thing though was the deep fried Oreos.

EsyayPEUBW0JsEGRMOJzBg.text: slightly better than my expectations. over priced. hot dogs came out cold when it's slow on a tuesday evening. the mayo is gross as hell. it's in a weird spot too. it's hard to find. if you see the subway keep walking go the end of the block and you'll see it.

IPwuaa3p12FaXwgSV0WYPA.text: This place is a bit hidden, but it's in the same center as WahlBurger.  We missed it my first time trying to find it, but after doing better research, found it on our 2nd day in Vegas. We came on a Sunday afternoon for lunch, and there were only 2 people in front of me, but it took a while to get my food (hubby went to try something else as he wasn't in the mood for hotdogs).   It started out as one person taking orders, making food, etc, so it took a while for me to actually get my food.  Hubby came back to order food from here too after browsing around, but I told him to go elsewhere b/c it was taking too long, and I'd already ordered. I got the dirty chilidog and dirty esquite (corn in a cup). The chili dog was amazing, and the bun was fantastic - crispy edges and perfectly buttered.  I had to save some for my husband to try since it was too good not to share.  The corn, absolutely delicious..... I can't wait to go back on future visits.

-bxQ9KOcQAa_RnC7TpSCsw.text: We came back, after a year of being home in Ohio, and we were once again struck with flavor and deliciousness--and wonderful service! We had the classic Dirt Dog, the Mutt Dog, and two different types of fries. My God. Our little meat-and-cheese loving hearts were in heaven! The fries were PIPING hot and fried to a perfect golden color, topped with roasted corn, cotija, and lots of other goodies. The dogs were enrobed in the best buns ever to be had. Vegas might be filled with Star chefs and their establishments, hip joints, eateries of all kinds; but Dirt Dog is king. We will always be back.

pTpdYO0iLQyUZGwkOexfEw.text: Dirt Dog is AMAZING! The hot dogs themselves were super juicy and flavorful, and the toppings were pure deliciousness. My wife and I had the Mutt Dog, Dirty Chili Dog, Dirty Esquite, and Elote Fries with a Mexican Coke to wash it down. It was all SO DAMN GOOD, and we were so full afterwards! With all of the terrible buffet food in Vegas it is nice to know that there are people like the folks at Dirt Dog making truly good food at a good price! I am fairly certain that anything in the menu would be delicious. When we were there the wait was about 15 minutes (right at dinner time), but the staff were super friendly and even brought our food out to the table when it was ready. They also let us know before we ordered that there would be a slight wait. Go, you will not be disappointed!

Bi1KQG2rOPnsfE-uLzFO_w.text: Dirt Dog was difficult to locate, so to save any potential blister prone feet from pain it's located in the back right corner of Bally's Grand Bazaar Shops. It's on the Wahlburger side if you're facing Bally's; in the first aisle of shops with Subway in the front. It'll be all the way in the back between Fuel Bar & Sin City Brewing Co.  I wanted to try the Elote Dog but the Green Dog seemed a more interesting choice. Bacon wrapped hotdog? Hell yeah! I was surprised to find the grilled onions & peppers had a lime or acid-based tartness that was not expected. Still, a good dog. Definitely want to try the Elote Dog now. In hindsight I should've gotten the Dirty Esquite (Elote/corn in a cup) to go with but I wasn't hungry at the time.  This place is a good choice for a quick bite to eat. Whether it's lunch, dinner or to combat the hangover blues. Limited seating  is the only con. Only two or three tables near the storefront.

O8SABNdUmPPmKQLECV03Xw.text: Located outside of Bally's by the little small shops. Good casual eats. They have a few options of hot dogs with filled with a bunch of different toppings. The corn is very seasoned and a must try. The fries are super crispy.

Their special carne asada dirty fries were outstanding. Crispy, hot, and loaded with a decent amount of carne asada and sauce. Liked the patty melt dog; it was larger than expected and had a great beef-bacon tste to it. Stop here for good comfort food.

QJURNx_kfnyqFVcdx3Bm8A.text: Great balls of fire this place was amazing!!!  Me and my baby ordered the elotes cup...delish and two chili dogs. The chili dogs is what elevated me into heaven. There was a VIP party going on in my mouth. The flavors were coming from EVERYWHERE!  Let's start with that perfectly warm, buttered and crispy bun...that thing played A VITAL role in this mouth party. Then the chili was impeccably prepared. Not too sweet, or too salty...just pure perfection. As if this wasn't enough the actual bacon wrapped hot dog sent me over the edge. That thing had me ready to elope it at the little white wedding chapel it was so good to me. I told my boyfriend he had competition...as I had never felt a love quite like this.  It's been two days, and I can't get this thing outta my mind. Like, I'm about to buy a flight for this hot dog. Anyway, the experience was over just as quickly as it begin. I showed that dog no mercy as I inhaled it. This is a staple for me going forward. I would never visit the west coast and miss this dog.

UEMydCRgc3bx_8Up_4soIA.text: Dirt Dog can do no wrong. Vegas is all about portions larger than life and buffets but their street food is also legit. The menu is really simple and I feel like it would be hard to go wrong with any of the options because they all look amazing. I opted for the Mutt Dog and my friend got the Green Dog (and no the Green Dog isn't faux meat, we aren't crazy). To be frank I'm not 110% sure what the garnishes on either hot dogs were but, oh, were they good and full of flavor. I'm from NY and I never got the hype of a NY hot dog at all and Dirt Dog just added on to that firm belief. I think the best part was that they served it on a lobster roll versus your generic hot dog buns. If I'm going to eat carbs, they're going to be worth it (not like I wouldn't eat it if it was a regular hot dog bun, but you get the point). The sole reason I knocked off a star is because I felt that the hot dogs could've been a little longer or thicker (no pun intended) for their price point. Rather than that, no complaints and I'm glad I tried it.

c5ASbLQTj7Ha03_lAu6oyA.text: One of the best hot dogs that we've had at the latest night!

uUgEC-zyzbn_2DkHXDqwAA.text: I watched a viral video about this place a year ago and have dreamt about it ever since. So if course as soon as I hit the Strip, this place was on my to-do list. Its a tiny little kiosk type store amidst many others, with no seating and you order to-go at the window. The food was tasty and decently priced. We got there maybe 10 minutes after they opened but they didn't have the ingredients to make the hot cheeto and elote covered hot dog I had been dreaming about for a year.... The fact that they were out of a key ingredient at the beginning of the day on a Saturday on a holiday weekend points to a logistics concern... But I ended up going with the standard elote dog and the flavors were really good. They also have deep fried Oreos served with a horchata whipped cream, and that stuff is worth dealing with las Vegas crowds for.

QHuzVS90D7kO70zxScMt_A.text: This was so worth, the search.  Finally found a parking spot & made our way through the crowds.   Awesome service & quality.  Wow, I might vote this hot dog better then the reindeer hot dogs, I'm used to getting in Anchorage

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SfDmL4LD5yalGEQEr8V41w.text: YUMMMM! If this place were open later, it would be my go-to late night spot for a night on the strip! Either way, I would enjoy hot dogs from Dirt Dog any time of day.   I found this place through Yelp looking for a quick bite (in other words, something other than a sit down restaurant while I was visiting Vegas). Dirt Dog truly hit the spot as the local fare I was looking for! I usually don't crave hot dogs, but these hot dogs were definitely quality. Just walking up to the stand, I could see how much quality their put into their product, as almost all staff were chopping up their fresh ingredients. The staff were super helpful in navigating their menu and their food did not disappoint! From presentation to taste, I highly recommend stopping by Dirt Dog if you're on the West Coast! Their toasted bread buns were really what topped off their dishes. They held up really well and tasted so great alongside the hot dogs and savory toppings. Their loaded fresh fries were also amazing, too! Crispy fries and plenty of toppings to dip in.   Shout out to Dirt Dog and their staff for a tasty and memorable meal!

PQk5Z2juKQJ5xu_ArDFvwA.text: We got the Mutt Dog, the House Dog and the Cheesy Corn ...the dogs were great service was great. They were upfront on the wait time for the corn. My wife wanted the Elote Dog but they ran out of the corn and was prepping it for the next batch but we couldn't wait.   The Mutt Dog - very spicy which I love so I give that 4.5 stars bc I don't give out 5 stars unless it blew my mind.   The House Dog- was a normal reg dirty dog...nothing special   The Cheesy Corn was very scrumptious!! 4 stars bc I can't give any more for corn on the cob unless it's my Mom's! Lol   Overall 4.5 stars for me!!

bv5FnryCzkCik7KsNhoY5w.text: Great hot dogs for the price. You definitely get your money's worth. The dogs are good and my friend has the corn she loved it as well. TQR7QSYbdXiowrw5eHOJqg.text: Dogs were hot off the grill. I ordered the Dirty Esquite and the Elote hot dog. Thought it was crazy for a hot dog topping but overall everything tasted amazing and I'm now a big fan!

JAf3gyJswstLNK10st5qJw.text: Never had dirt dog before, really great hotdog, I should've ordered more than one they were so good. This location doesn't have its own tables but there's tables outside nearby.

XVgkznUrVpQJz5RAi3i3OQ.text: Went to the little module strip mall on the LV strip. It was a neat little cluster of shops, bars and fast eats. It reminded me of shops in Mexico, just more modern and they had workers outside trying to lure you in by, offering deals and specials. There was music blasting. So it felt up beat and party like. We came across this hot dog stand that looked great, so we stopped to look at the menu. We only tried one thing and it was the Elote dog. Delicious! A grilled all beef dog, wrapped in bacon topped with a citrus, mayo based sauce, grilled corn, cotija cheese, bits of chorizo and cilantro on a soft, lobster roll like bun, that had been crisped up on the sides with butter. It was so satisfying! It had all the elements, that balanced out every bite and was just enough for a snack to share. It is outdoors and it was freezing that day. You have to find a spot to eat, which is bummer but the bars allow you to eat inside... if you buy a drink. This isn't the easiest to thing to eat and you are going to want to scoop up every, single, delicious bite. The service was good.  If you don't want to stand and wait, the workers will track you down in the strip mall and deliver your food to the shops or bars in the mini mall. This worked for us, since we decided to enjoy a beer at sin city brewery while we waited but please shoot them a tip! If you are in the area, you should test this out. Lots more on the menu that we will be back to try on our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LkltUORV4zRRsHzBSVUXLQ.text: You ever look up places like here on yelp and get all excited cus a place looks scrumptious enough to go get and probably be worth for the time being? This was that place that ended super negatively. A slap on any ones hot face. it's Vegas, 1 pm ish. Dirt dog is right down stairs from Bally's. I'm from LA so I know all about this place. And ive been to this location a few times in my previous trips.   I took a step out downstairs to order food, girl that was taking orders, all black clothing, bandana, short hair, light skinned, bigger than the other 2 girls, looked at me but didn't even greet me, say hello, here's our menu, if you have any questions let me know. NONE OF THAT. I said in my head ok fine I get it, it's like 107 degrees right now, you're next to a stove, cool beans I'll let that slide.  I looked at the menu, already knew what I wanted, I was just waiting for acknowledgement to order.... 4 min later.... "you ready to order?" in the most unprofessional tone. Kept my cool and said yeah I'll have the red dooo... cuts me off "we don't got the mayo"  uhhhh ok? You mean the aioli?  She does this shake on her head to what I assumed was a yeah.  So I said.... Ok I'll get the chili... no wait I'll get the elote...  Then she cuts me off again... "like I said we don't got the mayo any thing with mayo we don't got"  well then.... I'll just get the Chili cheese dog.... and as I was about to proceed to ordering more things because I was ordering for 3 other people she tells me... "8.72" or whatever price the total came up to. DUDE really? So I went along, paid my food and waited... the cook was probably the only decent person with customer service as she tried to serve me correctly and apologize for not having a bag for my to go order.   I'm all for good food but this girl needs a sit down with a manager or someone to straighten up the tone she brings into the establishment , she's utterly rude and has no sense of customer service. First impression of a business should always be acknowledgment especially to your customers.   The 1 Star is for that cook, blonde hair lady. You made it worth standing there to grab my food and walk away without saying a word back.

SoryyK0Q6XOMidR_oycVjA.text: We personally feel like this is an under appreciated hidden gem!  Located right on the strip in the Grand Bazaar shops near Wahlburgers, its an inviting judgement free little spot with a dope setup, friendly staff and the "dirtiest" (tastiest) dogs and fries we've tried on this side of the map! We'll definitely come back!

E_gFQ1HgC-jrN0rHRtCU7A.text: Dirt Dog has been on bookmark for quite some time, I found myself on the strip and decided to go for it and finally try it out. I got the Elote Dog. They use a lobster roll as a bun which was buttery and soft. The hot dog itself was plump and juicy and wrapped in a layer of perfectly cooked bacon. On top was the Elote mixture which was over stuffed(not like I'm complaining). They did give me a fork and knife but to really enjoy it, you have to just pick it up(even if the topping falls down, it like an extra treat once you finish the dog). It's not something you should eat everyday but boy was it great treat for myself.

G3FS-ef0y_V2nkIPu9bNkQ.text: We LOVED this place! After spending tons of $ on food the previous few days, we were looking for some good cheap street eats. This place did not disappoint! We got the elote street corn and the patty melt dog and both were phenomenal. Split between boyfriend & I, it was perfect amount of greasy, bad-for-you-but-worth-every-bite food to satisfy us for a couple hours. We liked that it was next to Sin City Brewing too, so we could sit at the bar next door to eat our food and enjoy a beer. The area this is in is really cool too - lots of specialty shops and eats throughout the "maze" - worth checking out!

iS0SHVkLBFpRhz8hZQnQ_Q.text: I've been here twice and both times I only ordered the deep-fried oreos. The first visit was great. I absolutely loved the horchata whipped cream. The second (and last) visit a week ago, was awful. Unfortunately, I bought 2 orders this time, thinking it would be the same as my previous visit. They were quite skimpy with the powdered sugar and when I asked for the missing horchata whipped cream, the girl blandly said, "We don't have any." Okay...? That was my favorite part. She should've told me BEFORE I ordered that they were out of cream or at least be nicer and a little apologetic when telling me they didn't have it. On top of that, the batter somehow tasted really SOUR. Very peculiar and I'm not sure why, but that was the worst part. Maybe it was spoiled or perhaps something like pickles were dipped into the oil right before my batch? First time was 4 stars, second was zero stars so I settled with 2 stars total.

wjxkSU3936tKcwNYS9IxPQ.text: 3.5 stars. This place had some big shoes to fill. We LOVE Dog Haus. Like best hot dogs ever. We were staying at Bally's so we couldn't pass up the chance to try a rival shop.   The menu on their site and the menu in person were slightly different, so it's worth doing some research first to know what they have to offer based on reviews. We went down a little after 11am when they were supposed to open at 10am and tried to order chili fries, but the chili wasn't ready yet (like not even close to being ready considering it was an hour after opening). We planned to try to come back and try the chili fries later, but it's Vegas, there are too many choices for food, so unfortunately we didn't get the chance.   My boyfriend got the flaming dog and I got the elote dog. I'm not a bacon fan (I know, I'm nuts - I don't mind bacon bits too much, just don't like soggy bacon strips), so I asked if they had a dog not wrapped in bacon and I was in luck. The lady taking the order asked if that meant I didn't want bacon bits either and I confirmed. When they brought out the dogs, the lady specifically said "elote no bacon" while setting down a dog smothered in bacon bits. Weird. My bf really liked the flaming dog. While I liked the corn, I just didn't love the combo of having it on a hot dog and wished I'd gotten it separate in a cup. I really loved the mayo on this one - I need to recreate it at home. I also liked that they served quality hot dogs on the buttered lobster-roll style buns.   Overall, my bf rates the place 4 stars and I'd hate to rob them of a star just because my personal tastes meant I didn't love the combo, but this place just doesn't match up to Dog Haus overall in terms of creativity and flavor for me.

JfiEqPkmqUF25hCq9MQ8yA.text: This place is soo awesome, the fried are so evenly crunchy. Hotdogs are like, will melt in your mouth. Certainly the best I have tried in years. Location can be tricky for first timers.  Kudos guys

Gff_2LZbbNL4rRrEdN7Vcg.text: The Dirt Dog was simply Marvelous! Stopped by to try this little Dive around 1am on a Saturday night... Not only did it completely satisfy all my cravings, but the presentation and deliciousness absolutely took me by surprise! I ordered the Patty Melt Dog with some Filthy Fries. The combinations of flavor on the palate from the Dog and fries mixture hit the spot! Absolutely Delicious. The hospitality for such a small place has the homemade family vibe with everything made and put together right before your very eyes a experience that's completely worth it! They offer you the Ol' Skool Coca Cola bottles to accompany the meal which to me was a total bonus. Also be advised that this establishment is very reasonably priced for the quality and portions they deliver. Definitely a 5 star rating and the quality of food and experience being a 10/10. Thanks

MwOvI78Tj6VuQlSYAjyYDA.text: We had arrived late in Vegas and one of the places we wanted to eat at had ran out of their food so we looked up what was open at the time and this place was still open and near by. It is located on the strip with other small shops. It's more of a stand but there are tables near by to sit at. I am so happy that we have found this place.  I had ordered the Elote Dog. Yes, That's right I did say Elote as in the yummy mexican corn. When it came out, I wasn't sure on how to eat it or even start to pick it up to take a bite, or even if I should cut it into pieces first. The first bite...man it was so yummy that I just picked it up, regardless on how messy it can get and just kept eating.  So yummy, the bun is, I am not too sure but it seems like a buttermilk bun that was buttered on the outside and grilled to perfection. That housed a bacon wrapped polish like hotdog. With all the elote trimmings, from bacon bits, parmesean cheese, dash of tajin, sweet corn, cilantro, and they give you a slice of lime, and when you squeeze that lime on it...it just brings all that explosive flavors together. Best hot dog I ever had that I even came back the next day and ordered it again.  You can even get the elote in a small cup and it's very tastey. They have many variations on hot dogs that I didn't try but the Elote dog is the hot dog that will def bring me back again.

Cf_18Xi23JI3enntARt4DQ.text: Service was amazing & they're Bacon-Wrapped Dogs are simply killer! Highly recommend. Victor recommended the deep fried oreos & the hot cheetos elote and he was dead on. Definitely a come back to spot when in Las Vegas.

mVHbKA829u7LQUflDXzoQA.text: Very good hot dog quality with some slightly weird flavor profile decisions.   I ordered both the Elote and the House dog. I felt both were slightly odd flavor/texture choices. However, the bun was "lobster roll" style, which I guess just means it was buttered. This was quite decadent, in its savoriness.   The hot dog is large and of high quality. It tastes of pure beef and fat. It holds a solid bite.   The Elote dog is covered with corn, parmesan cheese, and some endless panoply of other toppings.   My advice would be to stick to the most basic dog you can find here. The toppings just sort of distracted from the nice hot dog.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elote Dog

z2Y2S2ifld1VlehFSGf1Tg.text: The hot dogs themselves are some of the best I've tasted. They have a wide variety of options and I went with the elite dog. It was the perfect amount of corn and cheese and it was something for my taste buds to behold.

09KqFpSC_31fLsUBeT_PKw.text: This place is "OFF THE CHAIN!!!!!" 1st time to Las Vegas & we couldn't have found a better lunch spot!!!!!! The staff is extremely friendly as well!!!!!

yHJl9Xs7lW6BbwdtHV-dCQ.text: The elote hot dog. DELICIOUS. I don't know what other word best describes it. Everything about it was delicious and it was extremely filling. I highly recommend if you want to get your grub on with some hot dogs and not have your typical chili dogs cause that was really all I saw around Vegas. Dirt Dog had a nice variety to choose from compared to everywhere else.

TFWNL40p4M78Ua9Fe-QQSQ.text: Zack and Justice were so friendly and had an awesome vibe while being patient and helping me and my aunt pick out what we wanted. Zack recommends the chili dog and it was AMAZING. Love this place

qa0uwkdURiwLJcMCVQxnFw.text: This is the street food of Vegas! Surprisingly this was my best meal for my most recent visit! If you are looking for good cheap food then this is the place. Came here for lunch. The place is very small with limited seating outside. Everything on the menu sounded interesting. Wanted to order a dirty chili dog but the chili wasn't ready yet. I ended up with a green dog and my wife ordered a red dog. We also got a side of elote fries. Everything was delicious. I must say, it was probably the best hot dogs I've EVER had.   Came back a second time before we left to try my dirty chili dog and my wife got the house dog. My chili dog was also delicious and one of the top chili dogs I've had but I enjoyed the green dog and my wife's red dog from the visit before more. I wasn't a huge fan of the house dog but it was still good. Luckily we ordered a mutt dog to share that was half red and half green for the last taste in my mouth.   This will be my go to place for good cheap street food along side with Tacos El Gordo depending on what side of the strip in at.

Ghlpe9sF2Cix6tDTtQKeaQ.text: We got the House Dog and the Elote Fries at the recommendation of the staff - who were so nice and helpful. Really genuinely caring staff - Matthew went above and beyond to help us! Both dishes were delicious the House Dog sounds simple but the flavors are on point. A really good quick lunch spot, and we sat in Fuel Bar and they brought the food right over while we had drinks.

8kK3Fbs92iwcbOAXsKlSYw.text: Been wanting to check this place out forever and I am so glad we did. We will be coming back for sure!

ZbvIBzDA2AEEiV2GbwseqQ.text: Stopped by Dirt Dog on the strip for a quick bite to eat and Elijah hooked us up with some K-town wings.  They were awesome and we are definitely coming back for more.

3on-nZz2SR5mcXaORPRoJw.text: I don't get why this is rated so high?  flavor wasn't bad, but @ $8 per dog - I won't be back  These are not hotdogs you can eat walking the strip, unless you want to wear most of it, and this location is just a stand really  - no seating except for benches and a tables in the outdoor mall - and you don't mind eating a hot dog on the 100+ degree sidewalk  someone in front of us ordered some nachos, so we saw the fry machine that they use, and how it failed to cook half of the chips as the employee stood there picking through what the machine dumped out

5rRujCO1PLgtfcZgji8_fw.text: The hot dogs were all so good and everything was awesome. The wait was a bit but it's a really small location and they were pretty busy so it's expected. I felt like some hot wings so I ask the guys what's your hottest wings, I believe they only had 3 flavors. They tell me we'll are you really up for a challenge? Because we can make them as hot as your want. I was up for the challenge and said yea make me the hottest you can. Was I glad I did, they might have been some of the hottest but most delicious wings ever. All with a on the spot sauce. If you want some heat, don't hesitate to ask for something different. By the end of the night my mouth was on fire but I love heat so it was well worth it, by far hotter then BWW or Wingstop and 10x more flavorful. This place is awesome and the cooks and employees are really cool and friendly.

j6yN1SYVwMB3JSvPYzmcyg.text: OMG. Mutt Dog one of the best dogs I've ever had! Period. And the elote fries were delicious. Need a cheap, tasty lunch on the Vegas Strip? Beat a path to Dirt Dog.

IorNcQlavnve462If31QeA.text: I saw this place on yelp while looking for aces to eat and I knew I had to try it out! The cashier/cook was super helpful and explained each item they had on their menu and was really friendly! Prices weren't too crazy for the strip and the dogs came out quick! I ate the red dog which was offered a nice kick of spice with the chipotle aioli and spicy tomato sauce! The onions were cooked to perfection and offered great texture! The hotdog itself was huge and tasty! I also tried deep fried oreos for the first time here and with the horchata cream, these were so bomb! Super soft and on the inside and warm with a crunchy outside! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves gourmet hotdogs!

7HFOP1T4oPu8Asf6YkbNVQ.text: Absolutely delicious and priced reasonably. We got what was basically a chili dog with what tasted like Que Bueno inside. So so soooooooooo good and definitely reminded me of LA "street food" but more fulfilling. Also got the "dirty corn," which is covered in I think cottage cheese and cotija.   We liked it so much that we actually went back right after inhaling the meal and got the exact same thing, plus some wings. Can't wait to check out the other Dirt Dog in LA.

pxUsgd-Lvprc7KcFkXWsZA.text: Tucked away from everything and limited choices but fantastic. The Mexican street corner was fantastic and the chili dog was phenomenal. Must have!

IzKrTlscUTHZrQMHX7jjgA.text: Do you are the bomb hotdogs are worth the wait. Excellent choice if you want a hot dog.

wb9M_dMJkRbJ71cM3rMMdg.text: Great dogs and fries! It was kinda hard to find, but well worth the search! We grabbed a beer next door and they delivered our food to our table quickly!

rQnuOKbJPoK_GXGL1NeNFw.text: Went to Dirt Dog twice in my four nights in vegas --- and i'm thinking about going again tonight.   The good:  It was cheap, fast, and convenient. Has some outdoor seating nearby, whether its specifically for Dirt Dog I'm not 100% sure.  The Hot Dogs were plump and juicy, the buttered bread was cripsy on the outside and soft on the inside. I had the spicy option on day one then last night I had the number one with the peppers and onions.  Both were excellent although i'll give the nod to the spicy dog.  Didn't try anything but the two dogs.   The ok:  Communication between staff was good on Tuesday, Wednesday needed some work. When i went on Tuesday there was no line so ordering was easy, pickup was easy etc. Wednesday night was a little different as there was several orders in front of me and it seemed like the staff had no clue who ordered what even though you provided them your first name for the order. There were more people working as well which could've added to the confusion as it such a small space.   All in all I had a great experience. It's making me hungry just thinking about it... I may go back a third time before my flight home. If I'm back next year for our annual conference I'll definitely make my way over to try another option.

znehAU_ugcnwmRVGBeQMnQ.text: So after walking all over the strip and walking by all the crowded and often over priced restaurants on the strip, we go searching for this hidden gem. I'm so glad we did because these hot dogs were incredible! I even got the elotes in a cup and that was amazing as well!  Health food this ain't!  But if you want a trip to flavor town, this is your ticket!!!  I definitely want to come back here next time in Vegas!

WF8IoT_39msbD5Ybh-fTrw.text: I ordered a patty melt hotdog and it was AMAZING. Just the right amount of cheese. Was expecting the fries that were bathed in the cheese to be soggy but they were super crunchy! The hotdog itself was delicious and flavorful, you can definitely tell that it's high quality. The people operating the shop, you can tell, were down-to-earth and were nice even though they were in the humid Vegas weather combined with the heat coming from cooking the dogs. This is my first gourmet hot dog that I've ever had and I definitely don't regret it. If you're ever in Vegas, DEFINITELY GRAB A BITE FROM THIS PLACE! I highly recommend the patty melt hotdog.

kle1MUjNp5j3Ybp0zWVnsA.text: Quick version of review: It was tasty! Had the elote dog. Worth trying.  More detailed version:  $9 hot dog is pricey but it's gourmet I guess and on the strip, so the price reflects that. Bun was buttery and toasted, aka delicious. The elotes were flavorful and the dog as a whole was filling. I kind of viewed it as paying $9 for a premium hot dog with a side (the elotes) on top.   My wait time wasn't bad at all, only had to wait 5 min (on a Monday early evening). People have mentioned the long wait, and I'd say if you see a long line might be worth revisiting at a more convenient time.   Unclear why it's called Dirt Dog...  I give this place a thumbs up. Try for yourself, especially if there isn't much of a line.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f4AoYTMcxW9-7DgnYBpgcw.text: One of my friends heard there was a Dirt Dog in Vegas and it was all he could suggest during our trip there. Finally after an extremely late night, promising him Dirt Dog was the only way we could get him out of bed and outside into the sunlight. He went directly for the Elote Dog and deep fried oreos. Honestly after the several years I've known him, I've never seen him this happy before.  I went with the Elote Dog and shared half of it with another friend who ordered the Dirty Chili Dog. I loved the chili on her hot dog, but I'll have to say the Elote Dog is pretty unique. The people working here were also amazing and we pretty much had a dance battle while they prepared our food. I wouldn't mind coming back here next time I need my hot dog fix in Vegas.

fPtcyAuh_umM9Qb2ET3tUA.text: Dogs are so good. So far I've had the pastrami dog which was really good and the Green dog which is my favorite so far. It's a hot dog with chimichurri sauce and guacamole spread. They also have good beers on tap.

6dIxdPRbTgozsAAMFvlgkw.text: If you're trying to recover from a wild night, this is the place to do it. Wildly unhealthy, but super satisfying. You'll need a nap afterwards.  They have a tiny space in the Grand Bazaar Shops. You might have to search a bit, but it's well worth it.  Let me just say: Lobster rolls and hot dogs together just makes sense. A rich bun and a salty dog? Yes please.  The Elote Dog was nice and bright, but the Dirty Chili Dog was the king of the meal. The Dirty Fries were nice and crispy as advertised and the Dirty Corn was a nice twist on the traditional elote. We knew their Deep-fried Oreos wouldn't disappoint either.  I can't give a perfect score since my order was completely skipped, but I'll be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

_JQ-suJUlt2LkpP1ewNdQA.text: Victor was my server and he was amazing! Food was LA all the way made me feel at home ! Definitely recommend they need their own restaurant!

FHi_sMqATlLf-EcAgjaXXA.text: Amazing...how's that ?  So we found ourselves craving a hot dog in Vegas. We found this spot right outside our Ballys hotel.   Atmosphere ??? It's vegas right on the strip. The prices, not bad. The service is friendly and the food is amazing. They have a great variety of hot dogs which are just tantalizing. We tried four different types and they were all fantastic.   If your craving a hot dog don't hesitate and stop here.

pZUothHiZNk4JQCzAInzPA.text: Dear Readers,  I just ate the best chili cheese dog ever. No cap. Like, I'm sitting here thinking about going for a second dog... i also had the elote fries which were good but in kind of upset that the flavor of the fries ( lime essence ) is overpowering the after taste chili dog.    Seriously best chili cheese dog I've had in forever

kM5UmqyF_eqF7nT7TAqEuA.text: Dirt Dog was just one of the very few highlights on the Vegas Strip. It's tucked away in a small shopping area close to Alex and Ani, across from a huge Vegas souvenir store. It's on the east side of the strip, south of the Linq. When we arrived, there was only one guy working. It took awhile for the 6 of us to get our dogs because they are pretty complex hot dogs.  It was worth the wait. I ordered the red dog. It was the perfect level of spicy. The bacon wrapped dog was excellent. (They are all wrapped in bacon.) the bun was different, toasted, and freaking amazing. I also tried the elote, Mexican street corn. It was delicious, but super messy. I didn't see the photo of the corn in a cup until after I got corn all over my face. I would recommend asking for that if you want to stay cute.

RjgclthvVFdp0W1CU9usWw.text: Up until a couple of weeks ago I had never tried the Mexican corn on the cob...all of that changed when my sister came home with the choice of regular or hot cheetos corn. So from the first bite my lips were on fire by bite five the fire was extinguished by the juicy, sweet nectar from these amazing golden kernels covered in red fire goodness. Best place on the planet to get Elote.

ye-PK5vphVkvDftXKWGcog.text: Great little hidden gem! My wife found this online and it took a while to find it, but well worth it! I had the patty melt dog (apparently one of their most popular options) and it was fantastic! The sauce was perfectly spiced. My wife had the Elote dog which was also very good- Mexican street corn on a hot dog!

izsDUpk_1efFQA0IyqtAsg.text: Absolutely delicious!! We had the flaming hot elote and the elote dog. OMG. I'm salivating as I'm writing this review. The elote was just WOW... the crunch and the spice from the hot Cheetos made it so amazing. It was just enough spice that it gave the elote such a unique flavor. It was addicting. The elote dog. I don't even know where to begin. The bread alone tasted amazing. It was soft and it wasnt starchy. They do not cheat u with a small and cheap hotdog that's for sure. The toppings was just incredible. We went there twice. If I could go there again I would. My only suggestion.... do not share lol.

ERtKa2csWW652_E_dUzkbA.text: GREAT dogs. I got the House Dog and my buddy got the Patty Melt Dog. He's a wimp can't handle spicy so it has his mouth burning afterwards. My dog tastes great with lots of toppings and sauce. We also got the Filthy Fries which were amazing. Crispy to perfection.  The wait was about 20 minutes, but well worth it. They also had the courtesy to deliver it to our table. I would definitely recommend and I will be back.

P2nZpGA7mGviGEG3xAzLEQ.text: UPDATE: so i was in my hotel room at Harrahs& decided i wanted dirt dog. i saw they closed at 2 & it was like 1:46 and i was on a mission ! i got there about 1:54 & they were still serving. i was quite impressed because usually people would say they were closed(i would) so i ordered something light because i wasn't sure if i would like it (something light being a bacon wrapped chilly cheese dog with bacon bits , cilantro and onions) . i told the guy how i liked my hot dogs (crispy) and he said no problem. fast forward to after i took the picture of my hot dog. i STILL wasn't sure if i would like it because i was wondering why the cheese was so light. i posted my pic and my phone died right after i wrote the review below. then i tried it ............. WOW ! i can't lie. that shit was GOOD ! pretty much, i'm going back today to try a different dog and some fried oreos.   it's a little on the pricy side , but i'm sure it's due to location.... then again, they are gourmet hot dogs. they have hot dogs with fries on top, corn, avocado(you know everyone's crazy about avocados) , limes & they even have a bacon wrapped dog !!! who doesn't love bacon.  they also have the mexican corn with cojita cheese and everything !  fries and wings as well.  they do have fried oreos and twinkies but i haven't tried them yet but i will be soon.

dw9KusSVg-33VIyAzOOzAQ.text: OK, we are in Las Vegas.  Who goes to a place called "Dirt Dog?"  We did.  We're not gamblers, but among other activities, we wanted to spend some time on the Strip.  We bought $20 gin and tonics at an outdoor bar at Caesar's Palace, and consulted Yelp for an inexpensive lunch.  Dirt Dog is a hole in a wall among other small businesses, easy to find if you use Google Maps.    Low expectations, blown away by the food.  Doesn't matter what we had...  I'm confident you will be totally happy with your meal.  I actually thought about whether I could get a franchise back home.

Vh-3aKLItYOnCGT7ZyPSOQ.text: Delicious hot dogs. Love all the toppings they add.   Service was also great. The guy working there had great customer service and even assembled the bacon bits on our elote fries in the shape of a heart.

oXQ4cq4yoLdPZB4ydUymyw.text: This was hands down the best hot dog I have ever had.   So much flavor. First, butter buns and bacon wrapped dogs?!! Say no more. But then add the unique but simple toppings and you have something special.   It's a small food stand type setup that's literally the size of a closet. The employees were full of energy and good vibes... dancing and singing and whipping up some delicious hot dogs to the music. I had to go back for seconds on my last day of the trip!  Highly recommend Dirt Dog while in LV.

Kh-qghfZCN0omkZYEJiPqQ.text: This place truly lived up to its expectations! I've been following their posts on social media for a while and finally got the chance to try it on their location at Las Vegas strip. It was delicious and everything I hoped for. The fries were so crispy yet soft, the guacamole so fresh. I got the corn in a cup and it was delicious. The hot dog was amazinggg. I finish myself craving it now and therefore I will definitely be going back. I want to check out the Rainbow location since that one does have a bar, the one on Las Vegas Blvd is just like a to go carry out place. Although there are places to sit down eat around it. Overall I love the food and the service was so quick, thank you so much.

Comes loaded! The dirty fries were good as well. Right by the Fuel Bar, we sat at the tables out front and the cane and brought us our food piping hot. Super nice people. Highly recommend with the promotion offer at the Fuel Bar buy one get one free drink! Tip: it's towards the back of these shops by the redneck riviera. We may have to come back before we leave!!! YUMMM

gCwGp4pDbeujhuSmXJVwZQ.text: Wish they had more seating but man oh man this grub was good. Just the way i like it, sloppy delicious and tasty food. Too bad it's all the way to vegas. Hmmmmm

VjMcvvJm-a5iJVdqrkOPjg.text: The k-town chicken wings were delish! I will definitely come back to try other dishes.

ADAf0F6Henf0dbge4tvI-g.text: I got the #DirtyChiliDog the first bite was outrageous. Loved this place from the start. Located at the Grand Bazaar shops out front of Bally's near the Las Vegas Strip. This place is a must try for tourists and locals. The bun is slightly toasted giving a unique flavor to the bread. The chili  is unreal and the cheese sauce drizzled with bacon bits and onion tastes amazing. Although there was not a whole lot of seating available the atmosphere surrounding the shops definitely draws you in. Glad I got a seat but if it were peak tourist season I could see many people wishing for a place to sit if you are in small groups you might have to share a table with strangers which is understandable and what I had to do. Taylor was very helpful and she knew the menu and made great suggestions pointing out several tasty items for a first time goer. Giving multiple options as a greeter is nice because it let me know "You can't go wrong." She made me feel excited to try something new which seems to come naturally to her she just has an inviting personality. I will definitely be back for more. I valeted at Bally's they charge $15 for the first 4 hours David and Jimmy were really nice at the Valet booth and Blue was my driver and he was very polite. I asked to tip the valet guys through the credit card payment option and the valet guys told me this was not possible unfortunately I did not have cash on me. It may be helpful to add a tip option so that I and others could generously tip those that make the service so wonderful.

4w26XNU8SzxmTbgxC8h9hA.text: Absolutely delicious & the staff are extremely friendly! Highly recommend. I had the elote fries and they're mouthwatering.

BQO9dFDlaBhxzt5pxzXhGw.text: Probably my favorite place to eat on the strip. I work at Planet Hollywood and come here often. The manager is laid back and always makes sure every customer is happy. Definitely the best hot dog in Nevada.

A-Pi5KDKU9beJdNDaX02jA.text: Was craving hot dogs before EDC and lo and behold this little gem appears on our map right down the street. Its rare to find a legit hot dog place in most places I've been, but this one is it. The cashier was very friendly and recommended his favorite dog on their menu. I cannot remember the name but it was absolutely delicious. I'm confident their whole menu is of the same caliber. Highly recommend.

jC_e6SlDJUfbkBIKTUS6zg.text: Hole in the wall place but perfect combination of flavors in each hot dog. Took it delivered to the nearby bar.

lPypF1xblwWR5LaK4kPdoA.text: MmmMmmMmmmmmm...!!! My husband & I promised each other we'll eat here every time we come to Vegas. Lol SO GOOD!!!

hQm846yihz130ADkPObftA.text: We went here after reading the overwhelming positive reviews and were extremely disappointed by our visit. The food seemed old and smelled/tasted off which led to us getting sick. I would not recommend going here during your vacation.

hUShIIWG55xmNIRsW43QSQ.text: Elote hot dog was the bomb.. place is a bit hidden but it's in the shopping center where whalaburger is located. definitely going back next time I'm in town

wmQzHfTzVAyjZiemU-MxnA.text: I was shopping in the Grand Bazaar and as I walked by the Dirt Dog, I had to stop and take a second look. The menu was incredible! Teddy C. was the server and very helpful He explained what the different combinations were. These are not your average hot dogs! I had the Mutt Dog which is hotter on one end(red) and not quite as hot on the other (green). It was loaded with all kinds of toppings and definitely filled me up. This is the best of street food! Dirt Dog found unique and flavorful ways of serving up this American favorite.If you're on the strip and hungry for hot dogs, pass up the others and give Dirt Dog a try!

FMtqWSvFP_DLCxkNg59HSw.text: Tried to find this place of the yelp map. The location was off. Finally found it 1230 pm on a Friday . Not busy at all so I was disappointed when they messed up our order. We ordered 1 bacon wrap dog with mayo, mustard, ketchup , and onions. We also ordered 1 dirty corn. The dog came with mustard only. They left the corn out all together . I was hoping for a better experience .

rMkZ0v9kg5VvZoe2vUeY6g.text: Recently went to the location at the Grand Bazaar Shops after reading a positive review in local publication praising the specialy bacon wrapped hotdogs. There were a few people when we got there on a Fri late afternoon . Location is quite small so basically order at the counter and find open seats at tables located nearby. My guest ordered the 'red dawg' and they asked/offered to make a combo for addt'l fee - which included fries and a beverage - Coke is a cold glass bottle (no fountain options available - so no cups with ice). They were told to take a seat and they're bring to table - they got theirs pretty quick - I ordered the 'dirty chili dawg' - and made mine a combo - asked what options besides Coke was told Gatorade so I had that (it was cold). I was too told to take a seat and food would be brought out. You have to pay on a tablet (no register) I was not provided option to give email for receipt (the young man doing the order taking didn't seem too interested in offering or was very personable for that matter )(was suprised on cc statement was charged about $15 for hot dog, fries & small bottle Gatorade). Anyways so my guest is about 1/2 way thru with their meal before I get my hot dog and they dont' bring the fries. I have to go back - try to get the guy's attention that took my order (he's in tunnel vision mode) to get my fries (read previous comments about the order taker) - had to wait close to 8 mins or so as they had to make a new batch (after getting attention of the lady that brought out my hot dog btw). The fries were very greasy and didnt' give good amount (since they were so greasy didn't mind). Anyways - I don't expect 5 star service at a place like this but it could have been better. Too many other options to get a decent meal than this - wasn't worth it. Wouldn't recommend.

iP-woGzd8dn8skhuEnwaFw.text: While in Vegas, I got an alert that it was National Hot Dog Month, so I sat out to find a place to get hot dogs around 10pm on a Wednesday night.  This was second on the yelp search listing and a straight shot on the bus from my hotel, so I went with this location.  This is one of two locations in Vegas.   If you take the bus, get off at the Cesar Palace hotel, because the next stop is pass the Belliago and is about a six minute walk back to the Dirt Dog and you have to climb a staircase to cross a couple of bridges to get back on the correct side of the street.   I'd viewed the menu before leaving the hotel and although the hot dogs were too "gourmet" for me,  I was very interested in the garlic fries.  They are not sold at this location.  I went with fries with a chile and limon seasoning.  They were salty, but not inedible  There are no plain hot dogs offered, but they have 8 options with assorted toppings   I went with hot wings and ate maybe three of the five or six that came with the order.   I requested blue cheese and the lady told me I gave you ranch, I don't know if that meant blue cheese is not available, but I took the bag and headed back to the bus stop.  The fries held up well for the 12 minute bus ride back to the hotel, but the wings were cold and so heavily battered, they were impossible to enjoy.  Note to self, never get wings from a place with specialty hot dogs

UBEQR0tBwvSYwiFDE6NVbA.text: Dirt Dog has hands down the best Dogs I've ever tasted. Kate and I left the Tao nightclub around 2 in the morning and stumbled across this GEM!! I ordered the House Dog and the Dirty Chili Dog. Katie ordered the Patti Melt Dog. These hotdogs were as gourmet as you can dress a dog. The buns were made from Texas toast. All the hotdogs get wrapped with bacon. Now I remind you we got these Hotdogs at night when this place was closing. Usually when it's later in the day or better yet your last orders you wouldn't expect things to taste all that fresh or good. But Kenny and his staff must love what they do. I honestly felt like the hotdog couldn't have been made any better. Kenny also was kind and generous and gave Kate and I dessert. This place wowed me, who knew you could make the hotdog this special.   The House Dog: The hotdog is wrapped in bacon and has Thousand island and green chili spread. It's a heavy hotdog with tons of flavor. Honestly a little too much flavor for myself. It tastes good but was not my favorite from the ones I picked.   The Dirty Dog: is every mans dream hotdog!! The classic chili cheese dog gourmet styled. I haven't tasted a good chili dog like that since I was a kid. This hotdog far exceeds the one I had as a kid to be honest. I wish I lived in Vegas just for this damn hotdog.   The Patti Melt Dog: this hotdog came loaded with cheese and bacon and French fries. It also has an aioli spread that ties in perfect.   Katie said she wished she got one for the plane ride back home.   Honestly wish the best for this establishment and hope they continue to succeed.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The House Dog was good but the Chili Dog was the BEST
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Patti Dog! Yes

fW19-ndPvKDIY4ZpDBij_g.text: This is a hidden gem in the Grand Bazaar Shops! It's around the corner from Wahlburgers and Fuel. The chef is very friendly and personable. The prices are decent for the amount of food you will be getting.   We ordered the original dirt dog, the mutt dog, and elotes in a cup. All the hotdogs comes wrapped with bacon, which is the best thing that could ever happen to hotdogs! The buns they use are the England buns usually found with lobster rolls. It is perfectly buttered and toasted with a crunch on the outside and soft, warmth on the inside.  The original dog is pretty much the basics of what would be in a hot dog (mustard, ketchup) with sauteed onions and green peppers.  The mutt dog is a mix between the red dog and green dog, and boy is it spicy! Be prepared to have your mouth set on fire.  The elotes were pretty good, it could have a bit too much of cheese, but all the right spices are there.   I definitely would recommend this to all my friends and we are going to be returning here anytime we are in Vegas!

La2s9iu2vqr04tcX_BNFJQ.text: I don't know if it's because I just got my braces off but the elote was definitely on point. It's grilled so you get that nice smokey bbq taste but it's perfectly coated with toppings. I got the glamming elote. It was a little more spicy to my surprise but that could be because of the chipotle aioli sauce. But I have no complaints. My friend ordered the pastrami dog and fried Oreos, she loved it.

6feqlvNOjM-O9UruqrZvkw.text: When I heard there was a place called Dirt Dog in Vegas, all I could think about was bacon-wrapped hot dogs smothered in onions. That's what dirty dogs usually are to me. However, I was pleasantly surprised when Dirt Dog offered so many other toppings besides onions. They have ones with chili, ones with spicy sauce, melted cheese, guacamole, chimichurri and even hot cheetos.   $8 for a hot dog might seem like you're paying a lot, but the hot dogs are quite large and come smothered with toppings. Their buns are also not your typical hot dog buns. More like thick cuts of bread sliced in half, perfectly toasted and fragrant. MMM. I ordered the Green Dog, which came with Chimichurri Sauce and Guacamole Spread and I absolutely loved it.   Another thing that I was so excited for was the dirty corn they had on their menu. I would love to eat corn on a cob, but it's messy and gets everywhere, not good if you're walking around the strip. If you prefer to enjoy corn and stay clean, opt for the Dirty Esquite Corn in a Cup for $5. It's elote in cup form with lime, mayo, chili powder, cotjia cheese, cilantro and bacon bits. I would prefer if they added Tapatio for the spicy kick and more lime. Then it would've been perfecttttt.   I usually don't hang out in this part of Vegas, but now I feel like I have to come back to Dirt Dog again. They have so many other goodies on their menu, it's the perfect spot to get a quick bite if you're on the go. I highly recommend Dirt Dog if you're looking for a nice snack and don't feel like paying too much.

3yKlbV3mcEEo3RMeZxortg.text: Located beside the mall, it's a small shop that serves just hot dogs and fries.   We tried the pastrami hot dog and it was a hit! It's a bit more pricey than the other dogs but well worth it. It's a great snack if you are planning to split! Filling and satisfying.   The cashiers are nice. They do not have any chairs inside! It's literally the grilling station and a cashier station. You have to go find seating arrangements around the corner.

eksHWE2DeS5qCcghH5GBoQ.text: Best hot dogs I've ever had! It was my first time eating here & I am absolutely impressed. It isn't like any ordinary hot dogs that you would expect. I loved how they used Lobster Roll as their buns, it was so buttery & fluffy. I fell in love with the Elote Dog. It was loaded with corn, parmesan cheese, bacon bits, smothered with mayo on the bun topped with cilantro & freshly squeezed lime juice Definitely will be back when I'm in Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left: Elote Dog Right: House Dog

NExkE7ZtFedmC99EOwz23Q.text: I spent a few days in Vegas and out of all the culinary experiences both fancy and fast, this was the definite winner. I raved about it to friends and family long after the trip was over and it was honestly the one meal I consistently find myself craving. I mean I wouldn't even consider myself a huge hot dog fan, but the way they dress up this classic and ordinary American food with asian and Mexican influences is incredible. My personal favorites are their signature one and the elote one.   AND DONT YOU DARE LEAVE WITHOUT TRYING THE FLAMING HOT CHEETOS CORN. Crying rn just thinking about how much I've missed it. If they could somehow expand and come to the Midwest they would be a huge hit. We LOVE our hot dogs.   Give this place a definite visit while you're in Vegas. I tried so many other fancy places but none stood out as much as this simple hot dog stand.

9vikt8WHqaGp0kCgbHddDw.text: This place is BOMB!  Seriously guys, I cannot express how delicious the street food here is and just thinking about it makes me crave it. We stayed at Bally's so dirt dog was just a short walk away. We came across this location by mere chance and were captivated by the selection of interesting menu items. On separate occasions (during the same trip), I tried an elote dog and a hot cheetos dog here which were both absolutely delicious (I love elotes and hot cheetos)! Further, I was able to try deep fried oreos and deep fried twinkies for the first time. The oreos were everything - if you haven't tried, you absolutely have to! The prices weren't terribly high (considering it's Las Vegas) and the food was worth every penny. If you are in Vegas - you absolutely have to try dirt dog!

882gCPbg3TQW4kZyNmhjHg.text: Elote dog. Wow. 10/10! Delicious flavors. Great quality hot dog topped with delicious toppings the mayo was perfect, the lime, the cilantro. And of course the corn. 77xc0H3MwIBvItk7aqN17Q.text: My boyfriend and I came here hoping they'd take Apple Pay because our main credit cards were recently stollen on the strip. We asked the cook if they take Apple Pay and she just kindly said no. We had no choice but to bust out the credit card that was either a hit or miss due to security when traveling far. When we ordered the card was declined. We were upset that everything was going wrong the entire day so we apologized and walked back to our hotel to see if there are other places that will take Apple Pay. My boyfriend and I sat down for a minute to call the bank to see why our card was declined. The girl from dirty dog went to hunt us down with the food we ordered in her hand. She said she had already started on our order and she was going to give it to someone else if we didn't want the food. We thanked the girl (didn't get her name) for being so kind to us and took her offer.   The hot dogs though! They were the best hot dogs that we have ever had. Very flavorful and delicious! I planned on going back to the hotel, get some cash and walk back to give her a nice tip for her kind gesture. By the time we got to the hotel my feet was already in so much pain from all the walking. I feel bad I didn't get to do what I wanted by going back to dirt dog. If you are the owner and reading this, please reach out to me so we can discuss how I can repay you for such a nice gesture that made our bad day better.

7Opc6HMQO0D_xU_gvKVIaA.text: My friends and I really wanted to check this place out during our stay and we got to make it happen after a night of clubbing! We all wanted to try their elote dog and the elote in a cup but since they were closing soon they said they didnt have enough corn for all three of us and that the only corn they had was on the cobb. But luckily the guy making our food was nice enough to cut the corn off the cob for us!! (Yes we tipped him fat for this) lol.   I ended up getting the Flaming Elote dog and the DUI fries, which i didnt see on the menu but the worker recommended it since it was my first time!   The hotdog was SO GOOD! Had an explosion of flavors! Corn, hot cheetos, and an aioli sauce on the hot dog all coming together in a nice toasty soft bread. Got a little salty towards the end but still good.   The fries were also delicious AF! Highly recommend trying it out. The fries were perfectly crispy and were so fresh. They were covered in pastrami, carne asada, cheese, and a chipotle sauce. Sooooooo amazing!!!   All the employees were dope and chill! Loved the vibez here! Will come back again when i visit.

I gotta say, it is the best elotes I've ever tried. My mouth is literally getting watery from just thinking about it. It was delicious!!! I will need to come back to try their hot dogs next time I'm in the area. Hopefully soon!

bVH5SIxsl6XihR3a9Vw8EA.text: I innocently headed out for a Vegas night on the Strip, but, like so many before me, eventually ended up jamming a big dirty weiner in my mouth. Actually, it was two. I loved both.   The first was a House Dog with Bacon Thousand Island and Green Chile Spread while the second was a Red Dog with everything plus a perfectly-spicy Ghost Pepper Sauce. Be sure to check out all the extra sauces Dirt Dog has because your mouth will thank you. Also, just go ahead and get the Dirty Corn Elote loaded with Mexican Crema, Cotija Cheese, Cilantro, Bacon Bits, and Chili Powder. Don't be coy. You know you want to jam it down your throat, too.  The whole encounter was brief, but memorable at Dirt Dog in the Grand Bazaar Shops (in front of Bally's). I have no idea the guy's name working there, but I'll never forget his positive attitude or the hot dog-stuffed buns he gave me for my first time at Dirt Dog.

pNlRsJQENzDSPocS5scYrQ.text: This is in the newish food/drink outdoor complex right in front of Bally's. It's near/next to Wahlburgers and Giordano's. The very last (or most right if facing Bally's) ailse.   Awesome juicy bacon-wrapped hot dog in a fluffy buttery lobster roll bun. I thought the bun would be too bready for the hot dog but the dog was huge and filled it in with the toppings easily.   They were incredibly slow when I ordered it for Saturday 12pm lunch time. I waited for 20 minutes to get mine. They only have limited space to cook so if you miss the cutoff, your wait is significantly longer. This happened to my friends who ordered right after me and they had to wait an additional 10-15 minutes more.

ubWgw8P4bKFmpvp9L3TuSw.text: Hubby and I were at the Jockey club. I was looking for a Good hotdog on Yelp.Dirt Dog came up. In front of Bally's. It was after 6pm. It says closes at Midnight so I felt like we had ample time. We set out on our Vegas Journey. It was a little tricky to find because there's many rows connected to the eatery center. The nice lady at Ben & Jerry's sent us in the right direction.  At the Dirt Dog Food Kiosk we meet a local Hawaiian Randy. She was from Aiea, our island of Oahu. So I felt right at home.  Aundrea took our order. I want to say he is the owner. John ordered the Pastrami Dog. $10 Pastrami, pickles, cheese, mustard, bacon bits, sweet peppers & aioli sauce.  I ordered the patty melt dog no bun no chipotle aioli sauce. $8.95 Only fries, bacon and cheddar. We got a side of the fried Oreos. $4 I've read where people complain of no seating but it was actually very open. There were tables available and we received Table Service from Aundrea. He brought our food out.  It looked mouthwatering good. Cheddar cheese smothered over fries and a juicy hotdog. I was in heaven. I took a mouthful and realized it had the chipotle Aioli sauce. Just as Aundrea was walking up to check on us. As I was chugging the water. He was apologetic. Remade my food and gave me another bottle water. How could I complain. The service was really good. The food was just as good. Prices are reasonable. What more can you ask for. See you soon.

qcPcMVvzaWh9aSCFln3nnw.text: Honestly, it's just a hot dog with interesting toppings.  I don't understand all the hype. There is nowhere to sit besides some tables outside where anyone in the area can sit on. I got the elote dog and the toppings were interesting. But the dog itself is just so greasy! Like I think a dog has more flavor if it's just lightly cooked but these ones tasted fried or drenched in oil and then cooked. I love good junk food but this is a miss for me. I don't consider this good or memorable food. I'm only giving it three stars because the toppings were good. It was like eating great toppings with a deep fried McDonalds patty. I'm sorry, it's either just not for me or dogs aren't my thing.

V6vohhc8ES_45AVN5bHGYg.text: Wow! All I can say is I'm glad I came here. Dirt Dog definitely lives up to the hype!   I was staying at Bally's so they were easy to find in the Grand Bazaar. The staff is super friendly. Seating is limited to about four tables next to their stand in the corridor. I waited for a table to open up and my order was brought out by the staff.  I ordered the House Dog. They added just the right amount of condiments so it wasn't overpowering. The bun is grilled and super soft. I also ordered the Elote and it was so juicy every time I took a bite the juices sprayed all over the place. The seasoning was also just right. The Fried Twinkie was ok and came with a whipped frosting on the side which enhanced the flavor. Towards the end I was laboring to finish it all.  If you're ever visiting Las Vegas and don't live in LA I definitely recommend grabbing a bite to eat here! Time for a siesta...

25SB7OWMUfQfHZF4Yz5J5Q.text: The choices they have is great!! It took me a while to choose because I wanted to try it all. I got the flaming dog and it was really tasty. Such a unique taste. Loved it!! And the people working there are really friendly.

g-AuHAL6q_8sd85OxyPqHQ.text: So glad we stopped by this place!  Needed a quick food stop right before a show, and decided to get food here. It's located in the maze of shops right outside of Bally's. It's on the right hand side in one of the alleyways, if you're coming from the strip. There was no line when we got here. We ordered the mutt dog and an elote corn to share. I wouldn't say these are bacon wrapped, but the fine print does say "bacon bits". I didn't like the bacon bits as they tasted a bit stale and took away from the rest of the flavors. The mutt was really good though! The red half was a little too spicy for me, and it was 90+ degrees outside. The elote corn wasn't too amazing, but it was tasty as well.  The star of the meal was actually the hot dog bun! It tasted super buttery and super soft.   Prices are much cheaper than other places on the strip, so if you're in need of a quick cheap meal, stop here!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elote corn and mutt dog.

pqb2b87xAr7v_bdyRysWuw.text: Hot dogs here are interesting but do expect that comfort food heaviness right after. Two dogs and two drinks and fries comes out to about $30.

bFOp9C_t6SQ6o_nS1r5OXw.text: Dirt Dog on the strip? Don't mind if I do! Limited alley way seating so claim your seat while you wait. The dirty chili dog was perfect loved every bite. This is a hot dog foodies dream! :)

bzsr6nYgebCzI9fmsWlInw.text: I have tried their original location in Los Angeles, CA already and have raved about it to my friends and family. So when I found out that there was a location on the Las Vegas Strip, I told my friends that we had to come here for lunch!  FOOD: I got the Elote dog again because I just can't get enough of it! I love how they are so generous with the cotija cheese, corn and to top it off with cilantro and lime. YUMMMM. My mouth is just watering while writing this. I also tried their Flaming Dog, which isn't much different than their Elote Dog since they just add the spiciness and Hot Cheeto crumbs, but sure is delicious as well. Their Filthy Fries was good, but I thought it was a bit too heavy for me after scarfing down their hot dogs. I suggest you share the fries with your friends/family when you decide to try this place at. They don't offer free water like their LA location, maybe because it's Vegas?  VENUE: The store is located on your right if you're heading toward the Cromwell hotel from Planet Hollywood and it is down an alley. Unfortunately, there are many tables, chairs and shade for diners. I had to scope out for people who are done eating so I can steal their place after. Ahaha  PARKING: There isn't a parking lot. It is Vegas. You will have to park at the hotel parking structures or UBER/LYFT if you don't have a car. If you don't mind the walk and need to park your car somewhere, park at Planet Hollywood because that is the hotel closest to Dirt Dog that doesn't charge for parking.   SERVICE: There isn't much of a service besides them making and bringing the food to you, but they sure are quick!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WyQTMdrU_DupEbTn8Ldv1g.text: While my friend went to get a $20 Wahlburgers combo meal, I came across Dirt Dog around the corner.  It's just a tiny stand to order your food and no seats.  There are tables nearby in the same corridor.  Staff was friendly and welcoming even though they were going to close in about 20 minutes.  I just needed a little snack so I settled on an order of elote fries to share.  I wish I was hungry enough to get a hot dog, but I thought that would've been too much at the time.  I didn't really need the fries either (although they were really crispy and good!).  The grilled corn, with all of its toppings, was delicious.  For $8-$10 you can find some good, filling eats at Dirt Dog (in case you need to soak up some of that Strip alcohol!).

Rv-HMThdEytwc_VO-L1SjQ.text: Messy goodness! This place serves up huge dogs overloaded with condiments. There were a few tables nearby and we definitely needed to sit down to enjoy the hot dogs. I had the house special and I loved biting down into the sauce and the meat. The bun was surprisingly sturdy so the sauce wasn't leaking everywhere making a mess. The fries were also great. This section of the Strip doesn't get as much traffic but it's nice and sheltered from the heat, plus you get a lot of drink choices from neighboring watering holes or the convenience store next door.

bu80GEYqDTkttkzIdDGYIg.text: I got in late into Vegas. Checked in and decided to go get something to eat. Close to the hotel and had this bookmarked so why not.  Friendly staff, but they did seem to move a little slow.  House Special Dog - The bun was fresh, soft and held up well. It was good, but maybe a tad too much mustard.  Dirty Fries - Good crunchy fries. I got the spicy ketchup, but didn't seem spicy.  Small shop. There are tables outside a few shops down. They will bring your food to you or you can takeout.  If you like specialty dogs, give them a try. I will be back next time if I'm around.

Made sure we were taken care of and everything was good, hot and fast  Food: elote fries & pastrami dog. Holy shit! So good...  We skipped Walburgers and Giordanos for this and did not disappoint. Food was hot. Food was amazing and simple. I ate the fries and I am now happy we decided to get this food this time around.  We will miss you - until next time!

obR8SN8QyrK-LxX6jDmhAg.text: Dirt Dog was not only the best thing I ate in all of Las Vegas. But it was one of the best things I've eaten in the last year.  Thoroughly impressive that the quality of flavor they pack in the food comes out of a store the size of a bedroom.  I ordered the Elote Dog($8.95) and the Elote Fries($7.50). The hot dog was incredible, the Lime Mayo and Cotija were an amazing compliment to each other. The hot dog was hot and juicy, it had a great casing and nice pop(!!)  The fries had the same benefits and they were beautifully crispy and made to order. There was no question of freshness and the you can watch the crew crank out the plates right in front of you.  Worth a stop no doubt

Lots of different topping combos that pack a punch.  This ain't your grandmamas hot dog boys and girls!  We got the spicy red and the green chimmichurri.  Mmmmmm!  There are outdoor tables you can sit at but nothing fancy.  And it's juts a little window in a strip mall so you won't be overwhelmed by the approach but if you want a bitchin hot dog, look no further.

X-ZmW60zyri7mYxQiIm77w.text: It was delicious and I appreciate not spending an arm and a leg to eat. We had the chorizo dog and elote fries.

YH7lstgzROEa-KzHPVzdJw.text: Stumbled across the Dirt Dog stall while walking along the shops and eateries near Bally's.  Victor, the cashier was very welcoming and friendly.  You could tell the staff enjoys working there because everyone seemed energetic. The green dog was unique, with the chimichurri sauce.  The chili dog was smothered in wet cheese, chili and onions.  Gotta love the bacon!  The soft, buttery bun was a french roll.    There are a few tables and chairs where you can eat along the side of the aisle.  I can imagine this place to be super busy in the afternoon.  As a local to LA, how ironic that my first time at Dirt Dog was in Vegas!  I'll be sure to try their original location.

0eTQsiXMZkJdhLo_0U0jEg.text: First things first, I don't write yelp reviews often. My stamp of approval compares to the Great Ron Swanson. Best hot dogs in the world. I went to Vegas for my bachelor party in 2018. We all loved it. Looking back, we all wondered "hmm was it good because we were just really drunk?" Well, let me tell you, that was not the case. I just went back to Vegas and had 6 dirt dogs in 3 days. They were absolutely delicious. My favorites were the dirty chili dog and the green dog. In addition to the amazing food, the staff was amazing. Special shout out to Victor who took care of me several times. His service was top notch. Give that man a raise! Have you ever looked at a hot dog the same way you look at your kid when you're proud of them? I have. Thank you, Dirt Dog. #DirtDogForLife

O-_pcwO5Bp-r_HHWj6t4yw.text: Came here on a Friday evening in January around 5 PM.  There was no line and the cashier was very friendly and friendly. She took the time to explain to us what was in each since it wasn't 100% clear. There are only a few tables about 10 steps away, and i can see it being way too busy to find a spot in the summer.  However, despite the fact that these are hot dogs, they are NOT easy to eat standing up/walking. You need the tray under you and a fork to finish the toppings that have fallen off.  Between three of us, we got 2 cups of corn and 3 dogs (mutt, elote, and pastrami?) All were very good. The mutt dog was a little spicer than I expected, so know that their spicy is actually reasonably spicy!  I didn't try an elote cup, but it looked delicious and both of my friends really enjoyed it. The dogs are definitely filling, so I suggest sharing if you get more than one item for yourself.  This little shop is about to get REKT in the summer. Promise there'll be a line in the sweltering heat!

2pSXNCs1WNntZfNse68VLA.text: So I have this "friend" that had way too much to drink.  After a fun night out I (I mean my friend) ventured over to Dirt Dog.  Warning:  the place is outdoors - so if the temp is extreme, you're gonna feel it.  My friend ordered a chili dog and an elote dog.  Both of the dogs were solid.  The franks had pop, the toppings were great, and the bread complimented the dog (that is if you're into gourmet dogs.)  My only gripe is the limited drink selection and lack of heat -- it was a cold night.  Then again, there are plenty of places near by to sit where it's warm and where you can grab your drink of choice.  My friend that drank a bit much recommends this place even if the cold temp killed the buzz.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas Strip - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili dog and elote dog.

RNEBMtkBKlFdV7NuIqTFBA.text: The hot dogs are so delicious! Tried the mutt dog and it had just the right amount of spice. It was a bit messy to eat but so worth it. The service was also pretty fast and all the employees were super nice. Definitely a must when in Vegas!

kEk2SFbhoTsGYpmyxRNVzw.text: Was here again (I'm an out-of-towner) and even just coming for the fries and spicy ketchup is worth it.  Trina is a fantastic asset to their business as she was attentive and charismatic throughout.  She walked over to where I was sitting away from their stand and asked if I wanted more ketchup.   Little details like that to add to the *very* good food will keep me coming and recommending.

It was the first place we tried once we landed! We got a little lost while looking for it but eventually we found it in the shops. I ordered the Mexican styled corn dog and some fries! And WOWWWW was it good. Quality, flavor, uniqueness all came through. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good bite on your Vegas stay.

Y-sv4FDzoW-Nwf_goFA3nA.text: I really Iike this place!  I came here during my break at work a couple of times.  I've never been to the one in LA, but I was told that I definitely had to give it a shot.    The chili dog here is among the best I've had, and definitely the best I've had in Vegas.  The fry combinations with sauces are amazing as well, and I've been back several times to try them all.  If you're walking the strip and have a craving for a street hot dog, this is definitely the place to go!

WKl1NeTB7PgkqAliCMEKdQ.text: The hotdogs here are some of the best I've ever had! I was able to try out 3 different dogs: the chili cheese dog, patty melt dog, and the elote dog. The chili cheese dog was a little bit too cheesy, but other than that it was still delicious! I dont get eat elote much, but the taste of the elote dog was very unique. Be prepared for the smelly cheese that comes with elote! Finally, the patty melt dog was by far my favorite at this place. The French fries were crunchy and the sauce they used was very yummy! This place is a definite must try for any hot dog lovers!

8X_M-uYGaDvqMsV4osfqlA.text: We came here after discovering Pink's had moved and we still wanted hot dogs. We were greeted, ordered an elote dog and a a chili dog, and directed to sit at the tables and chairs under the pleasant cool mist dispensers. We were brought a free sample of fries while we waited. The owner (I think?) came out and was chatty and told us a little about the business' story, being inspired by the street food of LA.   Our food came out, and it was initially wrong - 2 elote dogs - but the owner quickly brought us out the chili dog and let us keep the other elote dog. Great service! It was really filling and fancy (for hot dogs!) and worth the stop.

25nS5PqsIB5TS51icG-9Fg.text: The food was amazing! We got the flaming elote, flaming dog, and elote dog. I would recommend this place for anyone that looking for that late night wienie walking the strip. Super friendly staff and really helpful!

They're manager/owner is very knowledgeable and passionate about the food they make, definitely am going back when I have the chance!

IOzOZ2c_7RE4lkr6J3feuQ.text: You will be doing yourself a disservice by not checking this place out. Wow! Who knew hot dogs could be taken to the level Dirt Dog does. I went for the patty melt, wife got the House Dog. We also ordered the Dirty Esquite and Dirty Fries. Both hot dogs were just amazing. The "bun" they use is one of the best pieces of bread I've ever eaten. The fries are killer, especially with the spicy ketchup. The esquite was so freaking good. As soon as we walked up, the guy taking orders offered us a menu and was pleasant to be around during the transaction and delivery of our order. Will be back!

U__Sq4mLHrqaF0lZVema6w.text: Quick bite for a delicious hot dog. Lots of toppings and something different. In the walkway towards Bally's. Curious to try the hot dog just plain with ketchup and mustard and next time.
