j-LhX50o5bkENbv36kqoEg.text: Every time I come to Vegas.. I'm going to come here!! Best bang for your buck!! It was bomb!best hot dogs I've ever had! Great customer service by Dustin and great recommendation! Try the Dirt dog! Highly recommended!

5hQAfz63wWkefTIxRTK7Kg.text: I consider myself a food snob and always picky! We stopped into a bar in Vegas on the strip for a drink and I spotted Dirt Dog. Having no clue who they were I decided to try a hotdog for a change. It was the best hotdog ever!  The experience began with Selia who was extremely friendly and knowledgeable, to the master wiener chef and the guy who delivered the dog to me! All of their hotdogs are wrapped in bacon and cookes perfectly!  I had The House  dog and it was every bit of delicious!

wNQU6Be9WQYs3Q1Ejcc8Gg.text: This place is AH-MAY-ZING!! I got the pastrami dog, everything married together so well. This place is a must visit if you're in Vegas and want a cheap but delicious eat!

Ca2W3xhjRovj_9zQ71rorQ.text: It's located right by the Sin City bar in the Bazaar Shops. Small walk up location with seating near by.   So the prices are great for a budget! They aren't high at all! I decided to go with the #EloteDog! OMG this dog is a burst of flavor at first bite. It was filled with fresh ingredients and she wasn't shy on the toppings either. Very filling in my opinion.   I will be coming back with friends in the future!

zRMw0bYvlyXkUwHdqAp8-Q.text: Had the elote dog - everything was so flavorful! The hot dog was perfectly cooked and the topping was spot on. A cute little spot tucked away just off the strip.

X1g0LB2KtQ0XaR68ySA9Fg.text: Hot dog hot dog hot diggity dog! This place was worth the find! I flew in from San Diego to try this place (literally) and it was worth it! I wish I took pictures but I ended up eating everything before realizing "oops! I should be taking artsy pics right now!"  I got the Green Dog and the Elote and both were SO GOOD. The customer service was excellent and I look forward to my next experience! #TheKingOfAllHotDogs #HappyBelly

YGZrZSSk0VwGGHDqO0MzqQ.text: Before you get lost using the yelp map- it's in the Grand Bazaar shops (next to CVS/ Bally's entrance behind Wahburgers. It's a tiny spot, there's some outdoor seating. The food was SO GOOD! Pricing was great for Vegas especially, like ~7 for a loaded hot dog. Green hot dog (chimichurri sauce) was my personal favorite. We got the elote, Buffalo wings, and three hot dogs. I got the "mutt" dog which was half red and half green - loved the green half so much I went back and got another one. The bread was buttery and perfect. Everything was great. The two guys working were super friendly, remembered our faces and brought us our food down the way. Highly recommend!

s_wcVTEeGDRTnEuT3mzWOw.text: I was in Vegas and ate at several $$ and $$$ 4+ star restaurants and Dirt Dog was the best meal I had the whole trip. Do yourself a favor and grab a dog and a side here. I had the Elote Dog and Dirty Esquite corn side. Everything in the side dish was on my dog so next time I will change up my side. Regardless, everything was delicious! The staff was very friendly and even handed me a coupon for 2 for $10 craft beers at the bar next door to Dirt Dog. If six stars was an option, that's what I'd rate it.

hF9qJeu652xUuV-WKannhQ.text: Great food! Great service! The cashier helped us with our decisions, explaining in detail what things were. He was also very friendly. The food looked good and tasted good. The cashier later came out and brought us a dessert he thought we would like, free of charge! Nice guy. Thanks again Dirt Dog Las Vegas!

The corn on the cob was also great, especially when you pair it with a glass Mexican Coca Cola. The manager was really friendly and even bought me a shot since it was my birthday.

iO1JU0HlwD0VWTw0r8C2pQ.text: We reviewed on yelp before going and saw how good the reviews were.  We gave it a try and seriously!!  Our words were....."this is Bomb"!!  The buns are like crack.  So freakin good!!  I have had many hot dogs at many places, even the hot dog carts in Mexico and this is top notch!!  We will definitely be going back.  Highly recommended.  Service was very friendly as well.  Zero complaints on anything honestly, and I am highly critical.

RrSXKwlf9a9cFOeZol7xjg.text: Visited this location several times during our trip. It's next to our hotel Planet Hollywood. It's pretty evident the guys working there enjoy what they do. The food is consistent with their customer service which is FANTASTIC! We had the Elote dog and corn cup as the side order- great eats for all of the walking on the Vegas strip. They use Nathan's all beef dogs and their buns are different & super yum! I think they are opening another place on the other side of the strip soon. Their original place is in California (LA). Reminds me of street food.

O08DzPO5nTgHMRHsKnb5Wg.text: We saw their video on facebook originally and had to go here because we love corn in a cup and were pleasantly surprised. Great service. Amazing food.  Elote dog is to dieee for.

QndaRO2lEMgjw8pYiGTVCQ.text: i got chili cheese fries and one of the dirty dogs!! it was rlly good! definitely over hyped but i wouldn't mind going again!

SgpYMrrbZHF7y2jzbiHdog.text: Great food, matt gave great suggestions and wonderful hospitality. Not a long line and was greeted immediately. We got the house dog and my cousin got hers with chimichurri for an extra kick.

MmjQCaPSXL0EaVkPKkNemw.text: Really good hot dogs.  Had the chili covered dog while the wife had the house dog.  Very good food.  Pretty good price for the strip. We waited about 15-20 min for the food but we were kindly forewarned when we order as a big group had order right before us. The wait was definitely worth it. Everyone enjoyed their meal.   My husband and I had the elote fries, dirty filthy fries, green dog and elote. We paid under $30 including tax and a tip, great value considering this is located on the strip. The fries are like a meal, not a side, and very filling. Every bite was delicious.   This place also sells deep fried Oreos and Twinkies. I was too full after my meal to order more food but planning on going back!

_499Jg9cvK9wb_gY66qLsg.text: Went here the other day for a quick bite. Been wanting to check out their LA location for a while now so I was pleasantly surprised to see that they opened a small stand type location here in Vegas. The menu offers unique hotdogs and sides. We opted for the Red Dog, the Mutt Dog, the Dirty Chili Cheese Dog, elote corn in a cup and chili cheese fries. The highlights were the Red Dog and the elote. The Red Dog ended up being my favorite because it had the most flavor and it was super tomatoey and spicy. The Mutt Dog to me was a brighter  -milder version of the Red. The Chili Cheese Dog was good but lacked flavor compared to the other two. As for the sides, the elote was clearly better than the chili cheese fries. The place was busy and the food was made in a timely manor considering there were only too employees working in a little stall. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

R64FWa3agvagRm0quVBzOQ.text: I had no idea this place existed but I saw a sign as I was walking past Wahlburger.   I tried the chili cheese dog and the elote fries. I've never actually had elote but I didn't really like the fries. It had too much mayonnaise in it, but the quality of the fries themselves were good. I was starving but when I ordered both, I was feeling full before my food even came out. I knew it was going to be heavy and overwhelming, so I ended up throwing most of this away. It wasn't horrible though, but I would probably try something else next time.  Thankfully, the chili cheese dog wasn't too overwhelming. They use a buttered bread roll and it looks like it's a lobster roll basically, so that was really yummy.   Overall, I think i'd definitely come back so I can try other things, but this has joined my list of must haves when visiting Vegas.

KxGfI-lOAsa1nsONW1MPhg.text: This was an impulse decision as I was walking into Bally's.  I got an Elotedog and their house dog. Oh my sweet baby Jesus. I cannot put into words how delicious every aspect of this meal was. The buns were light as air and grilled on the sides. The meat by itself would be delicious. The toppings put it over the top. I'm not sure which one was better. Make sure you are sitting down when you take your first bite. All the textures and flavors hit you. Time slows down, you find a level of meaning in life you did not know existed. It's that good. You are welcome.

hLXcayU2VxSFXROjaYbDJA.text: $7.25 for a hot dog *seems* like a ripoff, but it really isn't in this case, because the dogs are large, and then stuffed-to-overflowing with delicious stuff on top (and also because they have the greatest, fluffiest, most perfectly toasted buns!) I especially liked the dog I got, because I hate having to decide on a single flavor, and I didn't have to here, I got to try half a red dog and half a green dog (they were both great). I really wish I could've tried half the elote dog, but I know I'm asking too much there (I actually came back the next day to try the elote dog, but they were out, so I just got another mutt dog, which I was also ok with.) I definitely wouldn't recommend getting a dog to eat anywhere but right here, right after you get it, or it'd probably get soggy and fall apart. (Extra bonus of eating it here: there's a great brewery tasting room literally right next, so you can sit there, eat your food, and also have a great beer! To my knowledge, they have nothing to do with each, it's just a happy coincidence.)  My wife is a huge fan of chili cheese fries, so she got those, and that is an even more ludicrous amount of food, for only $6.25 - good price anywhere, but crazy good for the strip. The fries themselves were nothing out of the ordinary, they were just decent fries, but the whole thing put together was... not the best chili cheese fries I've had, but probably the best chili cheese fries I've had for that cheap for that much food (and also pretty good).   Another extra bonus, they're open super late, and this is pretty much *the* perfect food to eat after drinking all day and night in Vegas. (But it's pretty good even while sober, too.)

xUCEQunXw1Wm4FGIwRHlkA.text: Unique and tasty hot dogs! Got the elote dog which is basically a hot dog dressed up like Mexican street corn. And it's bomb! The bun is not your average run-of-the-mill grocery store bun.  It's the bread you typically get with a lobster roll, whichever bread that is but it definitely makes a huge difference in taste as it's grilled on each side til it's nicely toasted then filled with the hot dog and overflowing with toppings. They're a small place with no seating but you can always take your hot dog and walk the strip. I'm not a big hot dog fan as it's not my first choice when selecting good food to eat but this place does it uniquely different and I'll be back next time to try one of their other dogs.

WT6tpYLbauz5LJqkECmv6g.text: I HIGHLY recommend Dirt Dog , It was so delicious and the customer service was very friendly ! The place was clean and for the amount of people the wait wasn't that long ( gotta understand when business is boomin ) Thank you !! We'll be back !

FYjAwbvTtcP0_schyqcAEA.text: I stopped by to eat at this place because I am a hotdog lover and it was super close to the hotel that I stayed.   [Ambiance] A small place on the strip for to go/pick up orders. There are outdoor seatings outside if you choose to eat there.  [Food] I ordered the House Dog and the Red Dog. I thought I could eat two but they were actually quite bigger than I expected( I finished both of them anyway). The sausage was juicy and tasty but did not have the strong snap, if you know what I mean. They were very saucy, which you can already tell by the name of this place.  [Price&Service] The service was good. The workers were really friendly even when they were busy. I thought it was quite pricey but it was about average comparing to other restaurants around there.

8n_PaNSizpOeVVua-DoOCA.text: Great dog, great price, great elotes. The directions on yelp suck. They take you to CVS. It's in the small shops across the boulevard from the fountain, between Flamingo and Paris. There is a subway in the same row, just go towards the back of the shops.

IA0zE006TNbNI5Jpza9mGA.text: The BEST hotdog I've ever eaten!! The DUI fries (not on the menu) are incredible. Worth every single penny!!!

e_-wVvAgyrbapl4SLj23GQ.text: Omggggg the elote and hot dogs were amazing. I was seriously full for so long. I even had the fried Oreos. I will def be back to try something different. Everything was reasonably priced.

The elote frys are not of this planet as a local we are always looking for little gems and in the heart of Las vegas they deliver our total ticket or $21.07 was more than worth every penny we reccomend this place to any tourist or local it is the real deal

v3W8buBpjDKZxZifqKMMdg.text: It is a must go when in Vegas. The shop is hidden among the shadows of the Bally's Hotel and Casino. The food was delicious and filling. I had the Elote Dog, and Elote fries, which both were good. The Elote Dog really fills you up because I couldn't finish the fries I ordered. The staff was very friendly and patient. They really do not push you to go eat with them. The staff brought our food out to the table my sister and I were sitting even though I stood nearby to pick up the food. They didn't once made a big deal when I insisted that I could take the food to the table. The young man working there didn't mind taking it to our table. When I couldn't finish my fries, I went back to ask for a bag. He already knew that I needed a bag and just handed one. I wished I gotten his name to give him kudos for going above and beyond.

gKApQ5Bf8jXrGQnIczW8aw.text: I actually went to the one on Rainbow and whoo boy! I loved the place! Can't wait to go back and try something else. I had the "Red Dog". It was a spicy dog. It came with a roasted jalapeno and after about the 3rd bite of that jalapeno, the heat kicked in real good. My eyes started watering and I started sweating. My glasses started fogging up and I couldn't see, but I was determined. I ripped off my glasses and I started to get my second wind. I was half-way into that dog and although that jalapeno was so good, I didn't go back to it. I finished that dog and dirty corn up no problem. You're gonna need plenty of napkins because it's a hands on kinda thing and like the sign says "dirty". It gets messy but it's all good!

6R4F4lFs0ELQ97KKf_4NIg.text: Saw the Los Angeles location on one of the many TV FOOD shows and had made a mental note to visit for my wife and the ELOTE DOG, Was walking by ... HEY ... I know this place!! So had to do it. The food is awesome, the staff were great. SO MUCH TO CHOOSE FROM!! The wife wanted the Elote and they had just started cooking it, they we so kind, they offered to bring all our food over to the little bar we were at before going to him. Food was great, service was great, can't wait to go back!!!

pk9optdRl-zlHZCFSiVDaw.text: Surprisingly some of the most DELICIOUS hot dogs. The toppings are fun and compliment the dog so well. I had the Elote, which was AMAZING!! We ate the 3 times during our visit. Dustin was awesome and very personable! Rocky Balboa thanks you for the memories!!

N1VRinfKFfJHzCn4FHZGOA.text: THE BEST HOT DOG I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. You know those nasty burps you get after you eat a hot dog?? You will not get those here! Quality ingredients and great flavors in every single dog. The hype is really real. And you have to try the elote dog!!!

Oss1GE9hdeQTmItm3nCZag.text: Seen this places when i was walking around in Vegas on vaca and decided to try it out.The elote bacon wrapped hot dog was so good! I live in California so the good thing is that they have a Los Angeles location. Defiantly will be checking it out.

wjNhq1cGNzRYHQT3Hsgo9A.text: Dirt dog is simply amazing! We were craving for some street food and hands down, this was the highlight of our trip food wise. Very innovative combinations of street-style corn. We had a flaming dog which had just a great amount of spice. The fries were great too. Highly recommend !

xhi8QEOL0dNcOwc0RbhjCw.text: Finally made it here after months of looking at mouth watering pictures here on yelp and I have to say, I wish I could've got here sooner, SUPER DELICIOUS! The combination of sauces have your taste buds instantly addicted!  The staff was happy and helpful. Big thank you to Mathew who came to our table to make sure my nieces and I were enjoying everything And for sharing the background of this deliciously put together place. Definitely will be back #lovedirtdog

6V9j0Q-GrECO0ldQJoiT7g.text: Dirty esquite was delicious, the roasted corn was juicy and there was a good spice. Recommend if you are wandering by and have a craving for something light and different.

QhSMtUrUsL5CMAJcwshmSQ.text: Cool little street food spot tucked back in near Bally's. Some of the best Mexican street corn (dirty corn) I've had. They also had a hot dog of the same style called the dirty dog. Good for a quick bite.

gjlbpyKDcEGKOrFH8DhwvA.text: Great dog!!! Yumminess check out Dirt Dog on Las Vegas strip. They are going the darn thing her. Kaleb and Matt were awesome!!! Best dog I've ever had...I LOVE IT!!

dNp-rkz4JNrMGyMecOkASA.text: Tucked away on a narrow side street just off the strip is this quick, affordable and creative dog shop. Perfect escape from the slow and overpriced standard restaurant on the strip.

XYkfkaQc8CKJ9tU-aXGoTw.text: Tried this place since it was right outside our hotel- being from San Diego means that I have a love for those LA street dogs. I came prepared to judge, but this place surpassed my expectations. These dogs are the best, we tried the house dog and the half and half dog. Along with the ktown wings and the elote fries I swear I've never had food like this. The chef is amazing and personally came out to hand us our food when the wait became a little too long for our last dog. The service is great, the food amazing - I'll definitely be driving up to LA to stop at their restaurant once I'm back home in SD. The chef said their next shop will be opening in Orange County but I'll keep my fingers crossed for a San Diego shop!!

-SSt91lhszteHugLhHT23Q.text: This is tge BEST dog Ice ever had! We split the Dirty Chilidog and a order of Dirty Esquite. insane! The chili is perfecttly flavor balanced and the esquite is elote in a cup with a twist.  Come one come all, but you GOTTA come!

9Tsf1UwsKTClfEGppH_YNA.text: Tasted great. Very messy so be ready with mucho napkins.  There aren't many places to sit down and it is not the kind of thing you can walk and eat. Staff were awesome, ploite and welcoming. If you are on the fence they may give you a coupon to come back later.   Give it a try if you like funky food.

PGVRc6K5FQThYbhXKkZ_Vg.text: Best hot dogs in Vegas...hands down.  This place is amazing, with very creative ways to make a hot dog.  Will definitely be going back to this place!!

kKUrit8Ol-5KYnLSiiN2kA.text: This was a little hard to find, it's on the backside keep going until you see the wall burgers and make a right in the far right corner of wahlburger and the little shop is on the left. BY FAR THE GREATEST TASTING HOT DOG I HAVE EVER EATEN! I got the red tomatoe sauce hotdog wrapped in bacon. It was so spicy and good that my mouth was watering even after I ate two. One will fill up a girl, but for a guy that can eat I suggest at least two. They are about $7 each. Worth it.

drD1TXeDUz-9pzyQFP99Aw.text: The place is so delicious! The hot dogs are reasonably priced compared to the other food items within the Grand Bazaar. It's located right next to Sin City Brewery and Fuel Bar, perfect for after a drink or FIVE.  The food quality is great for hot dogs, who would have thought? And the service is awesome. Open kitchen, you can watch everything they're doing so that's cool.  I can imagine be employees that work here eat all the time. And I'd definitely move to Vegas just so I can eat this almost everyday!

k_gEBJz3HCUXPiVEt_iNCA.text: This was a very fun place to eat at, the food was awesome and the staff was cool as well... Don't go here if your expecting anything fancy or to sit and have a big conversation ... It's just a fun spot to grab a quick bite. Definetly would recommend elote dog.

QB5EIRGeWG92VOn8YcwuJQ.text: I wish I can give it more than a 5 star for their delicious food and great costumer service. I had the ktown wings and green dog. The wings are the best wings I ever had...I'm not exaggerating. I wish I can describe the flavor but you must try it for yourself. The hot dog is so delicious that i would say is the best one I ever has as well. Better than any Sonoran dog I ever has that's for sure. I heard that they also have a location in downtown LA and I'm sure that I will visit them out there. Great food and amaizing costumer service at its best.

00Zr5sQjO_s-HYHyq6mllA.text: This place is amazing. I was hungry for a quick snack after gettig toasted at the fuel bar. The service was good but it would have been better if they would've had tacos or more fryers available. Still I would give my highest of recommendations to this place. It's great. I grew up with am elotero an he's hard to find these days. This is the spot. So come and check it out. Joanna came by to check in us and we have her our feedback. She was super nice. I ove Las Vegas so I will recommend anything that supports our hometown. Please check it out. Hope you enjoy...

tzJfBMz3nrA4mjgUUewwRg.text: This place was amazing!!! Best hot dog EVER!!! Elijah was so personable which made it even better! We'll be back!

CGtDLmUAbQfVfmP6dBJ_lA.text: For a tasty dog that is a meal in itself this is the place to go. But don't forget the dirty corn! Love it and will continue to order this as a side. We were too full for the sweet options but will be back later this week to try them. Don't give up if you don't see the sign immediately. They are on the street ( in the strip of little shops before escalators)before entering Bally's. Go to the last row of buildings beside Whalburger. It's a tiny place with outdoor seating. Well worth it.

mT8eL8wfNNur2U6CRoNASw.text: Went there with Hubby and it was absolute delicious. I highly recommend and would come here again. The dogs are unique and flavorable.

YDmuFt-YuvkqVcV_WZ42wg.text: Delicious! Great combination of flavors. We were really surprise of how good they are. I'll recommend this place 100% you need to try it at least once. I had the house dog and fries. Also the price was good.

XpH95yMOfzq4ZXFNUnG2Fw.text: Amazing dogs...fresh, clean, quick and friendly... a must stop for late night munchies

l9tIDo_Wq7i-8e8558ESWA.text: Tried the Patty Melt and Elote Fries both of which were amazing!  The PattyMelt was recommended to us by the worker. I loved it but it definitely has a kick that I wish he would've told us about. My lips are still tingling a bit from the heat. Service was spectacular!  Super friendly and helpful!

joHSPXBP5swLcCePKrwFVA.text: Vacationing from out of town. Saw the reviews and gave it a try. Definitely the best hot dog I ever had ever. Had the mutt dog but liked the red side lot more. Will definitely try again if ever back in Vegas

PI_Jgoisy_b0FCnJBxb3jg.text: Loved it! I got the chili with the chili cheese fries! The place was small and does not have seating, but you can definitely order and they'll bring it to any location/restaurant in the shopping area.

wctainDUVmZuPP7jKw_hgw.text: Tried the House Dog and the Elote Dog--both are packed with flavor and the bread they use for hot dogs are delicious! Also had the chili fries which were good and packed with chili without overpowering the fries.

DeGPsyVxg1SLe-ZgyU3MsA.text: It was a little hard to find, it's right down the alley from the CVS. There is outdoor seating. The elote fries are amazing and the hotdogs are delicious. It is reasonably priced and pretty quick.

EKgA9IiJXgisZebzzmflSw.text: I've been to Vegas a lot of times and this is the first time I heard about this place! it's perfect for an afternoon snack m. I ordered the Elote Dog and it was everything I imagined! Their fried Oreos were amazing as well!
